titleStmt.title: T. B. Cochran and Z. Wheat to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6757

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: Last week E. M. Wilson of this County was fined $25 -- in the Court of G. L. Harbison Esq. for an alleged assault on one T. G. Doolin -- And the neighbors of Mr. Wilson signed a petition to your excellency to remit the fine, and it was handed to me for delivery to you.

The individuals who signed the petition were among the best men of our country. Myself & Judge wheat signed the petition I was so unfortunate as to loose the petition after it was placed in my possession, and to save trouble in preparing another, & trusting our respresentation will prove as satisfactory to you as the original petition we ask you to interpose in behalf of Mr Wilson, who is a very poor and hard-working man --

Very respectfully
T. B. Cochran
Z. Wheat
P, S, I did not Sign the original Petition but Concur in the above request.

Justice Court
Shelby County
vs
E. M. Wilson
$25 --
Assault
Remitted
2 Aug/65
